channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: AMS-DRL: Learning Multi-Pursuit Evasion for Safe Targeted Navigation of Drones
item.description: Safe navigation of drones in the presence of adversarial physical attacks from multiple pursuers is a challenging task.

item.title: BenCoref: A Multi-Domain Dataset of Nominal Phrases and Pronominal Reference Annotations
item.description: While widely studied for English and other resource-rich languages, research on coreference resolution in Bengali largely remains unexplored due to the absence of relevant datasets.

item.title: Interpretable Unified Language Checking
item.description: Despite recent concerns about undesirable behaviors generated by large language models (LLMs), including non-factual, biased, and hateful language, we find LLMs are inherent multi-task language checkers based on their latent representations of natural and social knowledge.

item.title: Asynchronous Federated Continual Learning
item.description: We introduce a novel federated learning setting (AFCL) where the continual learning of multiple tasks happens at each client with different orderings and in asynchronous time slots.

item.title: Fairness through Aleatoric Uncertainty
item.description: We propose a unique solution to tackle the often-competing goals of fairness and utility in machine learning classification tasks.

item.title: A2J-Transformer: Anchor-to-Joint Transformer Network for 3D Interacting Hand Pose Estimation from a Single RGB Image
item.description: 3D interacting hand pose estimation from a single RGB image is a challenging task, due to serious self-occlusion and inter-occlusion towards hands, confusing similar appearance patterns between 2 hands, ill-posed joint position mapping from 2D to 3D, etc.. To address these, we propose to extend A2J-the state-of-the-art depth-based 3D single hand pose estimation method-to RGB domain under interacting hand condition.

item.title: Adjustable Privacy using Autoencoder-based Learning Structure
item.description: Inference centers need more data to have a more comprehensive and beneficial learning model, and for this purpose, they need to collect data from data providers.

item.title: Generative Recommendation: Towards Next-generation Recommender Paradigm
item.description: However, such a retrieval-based recommender paradigm faces two limitations: 1) the human-generated items in the corpus might fail to satisfy the users' diverse information needs, and 2) users usually adjust the recommendations via passive and inefficient feedback such as clicks.

item.title: DualRefine: Self-Supervised Depth and Pose Estimation Through Iterative Epipolar Sampling and Refinement Toward Equilibrium
item.description: Our novel update pipeline uses a deep equilibrium model framework to iteratively refine depth estimates and a hidden state of feature maps by computing local matching costs based on epipolar geometry.

item.title: Toward Unsupervised 3D Point Cloud Anomaly Detection using Variational Autoencoder
item.description: We propose a deep variational autoencoder-based unsupervised anomaly detection network adapted to the 3D point cloud and an anomaly score specifically for 3D point clouds.

item.title: T2Ranking: A large-scale Chinese Benchmark for Passage Ranking
item.description: T2Ranking comprises more than 300K queries and over 2M unique passages from real-world search engines.

item.title: Domain Generalization In Robust Invariant Representation
item.description: Unsupervised approaches for learning representations invariant to common transformations are used quite often for object recognition.

item.title: On the Unbounded External Archive and Population Size in Preference-based Evolutionary Multi-objective Optimization Using a Reference Point
item.description: Then, we investigate the influence of the UA and population size on the performance of PBEMO algorithms.

item.title: UniSeg: A Prompt-driven Universal Segmentation Model as well as A Strong Representation Learner
item.description: Moreover, UniSeg also beats other pre-trained models on two downstream datasets, providing the community with a high-quality pre-trained model for 3D medical image segmentation.

item.title: Inductive Graph Unlearning
item.description: To extend machine unlearning to graph data, \textit{GraphEraser} has been proposed.

item.title: Super-Resolving Face Image by Facial Parsing Information
item.description: In this paper, we build a novel parsing map guided face super-resolution network which extracts the face prior (i. e., parsing map) directly from low-resolution face image for the following utilization.

item.title: DiffMimic: Efficient Motion Mimicking with Differentiable Physics
item.description: Motion mimicking is a foundational task in physics-based character animation.

item.title: PointCAT: Cross-Attention Transformer for point cloud
item.description: Transformer-based models have significantly advanced natural language processing and computer vision in recent years.

item.title: Face Animation with an Attribute-Guided Diffusion Model
item.description: Face animation has achieved much progress in computer vision.

item.title: Making AI Less "Thirsty": Uncovering and Addressing the Secret Water Footprint of AI Models
item.description: The growing carbon footprint of artificial intelligence (AI) models, especially large ones such as GPT-3 and GPT-4, has been undergoing public scrutiny.

item.title: Geometric-aware Pretraining for Vision-centric 3D Object Detection
item.description: We also conduct experiments on various image backbones and view transformations to validate the efficacy of our approach.

item.title: GPT detectors are biased against non-native English writers
item.description: In this study, we evaluate the performance of several widely-used GPT detectors using writing samples from native and non-native English writers.

item.title: Micron-BERT: BERT-based Facial Micro-Expression Recognition
item.description: By incorporating these components into an end-to-end deep network, the proposed $\mu$-BERT significantly outperforms all previous work in various micro-expression tasks.

item.title: NTK-SAP: Improving neural network pruning by aligning training dynamics
item.description: Recent advances in neural tangent kernel (NTK) theory suggest that the training dynamics of large enough neural networks is closely related to the spectrum of the NTK.

item.title: InterFormer: Real-time Interactive Image Segmentation
item.description: Second, the model has to repeatedly process the image, the annotator's current click, and the model's feedback of the annotator's former clicks at each step of interaction, resulting in redundant computations.

item.title: VLPD: Context-Aware Pedestrian Detection via Vision-Language Semantic Self-Supervision
item.description: Firstly, we propose a self-supervised Vision-Language Semantic (VLS) segmentation method, which learns both fully-supervised pedestrian detection and contextual segmentation via self-generated explicit labels of semantic classes by vision-language models.

item.title: Synthesizing Anyone, Anywhere, in Any Pose
item.description: Our main contribution is TriA-GAN, a keypoint-guided GAN that can synthesize Anyone, Anywhere, in Any given pose.

item.title: Mask Detection and Classification in Thermal Face Images
item.description: Face masks are recommended to reduce the transmission of many viruses, especially SARS-CoV-2.

item.title: Instruction Tuning with GPT-4
item.description: Prior work has shown that finetuning large language models (LLMs) using machine-generated instruction-following data enables such models to achieve remarkable zero-shot capabilities on new tasks, and no human-written instructions are needed.

item.title: Efficient SAGE Estimation via Causal Structure Learning
item.description: We propose $d$-SAGE, a method that accelerates SAGE approximation.

item.title: SALUDA: Surface-based Automotive Lidar Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: Learning models on one labeled dataset that generalize well on another domain is a difficult task, as several shifts might happen between the data domains.

item.title: Visual Dependency Transformers: Dependency Tree Emerges from Reversed Attention
item.description: When looking at an image, we can decompose the scene into entities and their parts as well as obtain the dependencies between them.

item.title: SegGPT: Segmenting Everything In Context
item.description: We unify various segmentation tasks into a generalist in-context learning framework that accommodates different kinds of segmentation data by transforming them into the same format of images.

item.title: ETPNav: Evolving Topological Planning for Vision-Language Navigation in Continuous Environments
item.description: To develop a robust VLN-CE agent, we propose a new navigation framework, ETPNav, which focuses on two critical skills: 1) the capability to abstract environments and generate long-range navigation plans, and 2) the ability of obstacle-avoiding control in continuous environments.

item.title: RFAConv: Innovating Spatital Attention and Standard Convolutional Operation
item.description: In this paper, we explain the effectiveness of spatial attention from a new perspective, it is that the spatial attention mechanism essentially solves the problem of convolutional kernel parameter sharing.

item.title: On the Pareto Front of Multilingual Neural Machine Translation
item.description: Based on our observations, we propose the Double Power Law to predict the unique performance trade-off front in MNMT, which is robust across various languages, data adequacy, and the number of tasks.

item.title: Multi-task learning for tissue segmentation and tumor detection in colorectal cancer histology slides
item.description: Automating tissue segmentation and tumor detection in histopathology images of colorectal cancer (CRC) is an enabler for faster diagnostic pathology workflows.

item.title: The Concept of Forward-Forward Learning Applied to a Multi Output Perceptron
item.description: The concept of a recently proposed Forward-Forward learning algorithm for fully connected artificial neural networks is applied to a single multi output perceptron for classification.

item.title: Exploiting the Complementarity of 2D and 3D Networks to Address Domain-Shift in 3D Semantic Segmentation
item.description: 3D semantic segmentation is a critical task in many real-world applications, such as autonomous driving, robotics, and mixed reality.

item.title: PopulAtion Parameter Averaging (PAPA)
item.description: Ensemble methods combine the predictions of multiple models to improve performance, but they require significantly higher computation costs at inference time.

item.title: A review of ensemble learning and data augmentation models for class imbalanced problems: combination, implementation and evaluation
item.description: In this paper, we present a computational review to evaluate data augmentation and ensemble learning methods used to address prominent benchmark CI problems.

item.title: Simplifying Content-Based Neural News Recommendation: On User Modeling and Training Objectives
item.description: Most neural news recommenders rely on user click behavior and typically introduce dedicated user encoders that aggregate the content of clicked news into user embeddings (early fusion).

item.title: DoUnseen: Zero-Shot Object Detection for Robotic Grasping
item.description: In this work, we are interested in open sets where the number of classes is unknown, varying, and without pre-knowledge about the objects' types.

item.title: Cerebras-GPT: Open Compute-Optimal Language Models Trained on the Cerebras Wafer-Scale Cluster
item.description: We study recent research advances that improve large language models through efficient pre-training and scaling, and open datasets and tools.

item.title: Zero-shot Generative Model Adaptation via Image-specific Prompt Learning
item.description: Recently, CLIP-guided image synthesis has shown appealing performance on adapting a pre-trained source-domain generator to an unseen target domain.

item.title: Quantum Conformal Prediction for Reliable Uncertainty Quantification in Quantum Machine Learning
item.description: Quantum machine learning is a promising programming paradigm for the optimization of quantum algorithms in the current era of noisy intermediate scale quantum (NISQ) computers.

item.title: Towards Coherent Image Inpainting Using Denoising Diffusion Implicit Models
item.description: COPAINT also uses the Bayesian framework to jointly modify both revealed and unrevealed regions, but approximates the posterior distribution in a way that allows the errors to gradually drop to zero throughout the denoising steps, thus strongly penalizing any mismatches with the reference image.

item.title: Zero-Shot Next-Item Recommendation using Large Pretrained Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have achieved impressive zero-shot performance in various natural language processing (NLP) tasks, demonstrating their capabilities for inference without training examples.

item.title: TagGPT: Large Language Models are Zero-shot Multimodal Taggers
item.description: Given a new entity that needs tagging for distribution, TagGPT introduces two alternative options for zero-shot tagging, i. e., a generative method with late semantic matching with the tag set, and another selective method with early matching in prompts.

item.title: ViralVectors: Compact and Scalable Alignment-free Virome Feature Generation
item.description: In this work, we propose \emph{ViralVectors}, a compact feature vector generation from virome sequencing data that allows effective downstream analysis.
